title.rendered: PM Modi, Australian PM Albanese watch India-Australia 4th test at Ahmedabad

content.rendered:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese arrive at Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on the morning of March 9 to drive their golf carts through the huge sports arena ahead of the start of the 4th India vs Australia match. It was Modi and Albanese’s turn to pass friendly matches to India captain Rohit Sharma and Australia captain Steve Smith respectively. Thousands of spectators sat in the world’s largest cricket stadium while two dignitaries rolled in golf carts. Modi and Albanese stood alongside the players on either side as the Indian and Australian national anthems were sung. 1. The Prime Ministers also visited the Narendra Modi Stadium Hall of Fame. The two prime ministers were also at the State Hall of Fame early morning. Retailers selling his T-shirts and other match day items in India sold out quickly.

“We are here to see Prime Minister Modi. He is our lucky charm and his presence will bring positive waves to India in this friendly match. Modi Hai to Mumkin Hi,” said one fan. “My whole family is a fan of cricket. I never miss a match in any stadium in Gujarat. I think the Indian team will be more motivated if we can meet more people,” said the relative. said Rakesh Desai, who traveled from Surat for the game.

According to sources, the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) arranged several game passes and distributed them to the public.

After spending some time at the stadium, some left. Mr. Albanese said he arrived in Ahmedabad on March 8th to attend some programs and Mr. Modi arrived in the state late last night. India has two wins and one loss, and he leads the series with his four games. Australian captain Steve Smith won the draw and elected to qualify for the series-deciding 4th Test in Ahmedabad.

_______________________________________________________________________________
